article_text:
BRUSSELS—Didier Bellens, chief executive of Belgium's biggest telecommunications operator, hasn't been shy about criticizing the government here, complaining about regulation, taxes and shrinking margins—not unlike many other CEOs.

What sets Mr. Bellens apart is that the government is also Belgacom SA's majority shareholder, and on Friday, Prime Minister Elio di Rupo indicated he was fed up: He summoned Mr. Bellens to his office, and...

twitter.description: Belgium's premier fired Didier Bellens, the head of the country's largest telecommunications operator, citing his record of unfettered criticism of government oversight.
twitter.title: Belgian Government Fires Belgacom CEO

image.alt: Chief of Belgian telecommunications operator bites hand that feeds him, and loses job.
